title: 111_s432
content:
The Act is titled the "Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental Policy Amendments Act of 2009." It amends the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to be known as the "Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act." The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to include provisions for scholarship, internship, and fellowship programs related to the environment and Native American tribal policy and health care, as well as environmental conflict resolution services and leadership. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to include provisions for scholarship, internship, and fellowship programs related to the environment and Native American tribal policy and health care, as well as environmental conflict resolution services and leadership. Stewart L. Udall is committed to making a substantial contribution toward public policy by developing the next generation of environmental and Native American leaders and working with current leaders to improve decision-making on environmental, energy, economic problems, tribal governance, and economic issues. Stewart L. Udall demonstrated distinguished national leadership in environmental and Native American policy for over 50 years. As Secretary of the Interior from 1961 to 1969, he oversaw the creation of numerous national parks, monuments, seashores, lakeshores, recreation areas, historic sites, and wildlife refuges. His leadership and vision in these areas are honored through the Udall Foundation. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS.

Amends the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act by updating the definitions to include both Udall brothers. SEC. 5. ESTABLISHMENT OF FOUNDATION. Amends the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act to update the foundation's name and adjust employee salary rates. SEC. 6. AUTHORITY OF FOUNDATION. SEC. 6 of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to include the authority for the foundation to conduct training, research, and other activities under section 6(7). Recipients of scholarships, fellowships, and internships under this Act will be known as 'Udall Scholars', 'Udall Fellows', and 'Udall Interns', respectively. SEC. 7 of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act establishes a trust fund with amendments to the section heading and subsection (a). SEC. 8 addresses expenditures and audit of the trust fund, including official reception and representation expenses. SEC. 9 allows the use of the institute by federal agencies or other entities. SEC. 9 of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act allows federal agencies or other entities to use the Institute for independent assessments or conflict resolution. Section 12(a) of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to allow the appointment of necessary personnel without following competitive service rules and to set their compensation not exceeding the maximum rate for GS-15 employees. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to allow appointment of personnel without competitive service rules and set compensation not exceeding GS-15 maximum rate. Additionally, the amendment includes provisions for renting office space in the District of Columbia or its environs. SEC. 11. Authorization of appropriations amended to allow necessary sums for the Trust Fund and the Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund operating costs.
